title: For Sale:  Coach Gun 12 gauge Century Norinco 1887 Remington Double Barrel Clone Model JW2000 3 inch 20 inch Cylinder Bore Rabbit Ear Blue Steel & American Walnut SG1090N
postcontent:
Our # LGSG1090N

Actually a better gun than the old 1887 Remington that it was cloned from, this Norinco / Century Arms Coach gun is all blue steel, very sturdy, with American Walnut stock and forend. We have sold China made Shotguns, Jin An and Norinco, now for over 20 years with excellent service experience, and we commend our Chinese friends on their expertise and workmanship on firearms. We refrain, however, from complimenting their packaging, normally any given one of these shotguns will have some sort of minor cosmetic flaw like the small dimple visible in the photo of the left side of the buttstock near the comb. These factors explain why this shotgun is $300 range, and its Italian competitors twice that much. These fine little shotguns weigh in at a healthy 8 pounds or so. Barrels are 20 inch blue steel, 3 inch chambered so they will accept any shells from our 1 3/4 inch Aguila Mini Buckshot to standard 2 3/4 inch shells, and all the way to 3 inch Magnum. Barrel muzzles gauge at .730 wide open cylinder on the right barrel, and .725 vicinity skeet or improved on the left, so light recoiling steel shot loads will work just fine; a person can even duck hunt with one of these if he is so of mind. Buttstock length of pull including their 3/8 inch thick rubber recoil pad is the standard 14 inches. While these are immensely popular in cowboy action shooting circles, they are also a fearsome weapon in their own right, always have been. In a current market climate where 8-shot Mossbergs are inflating to the $500 range, these are not only an excellent value, they are not only respectable competitors since the first shot, after all, is the most important in any scenario. These are also downright attractive. We're offering the one in the photo or one of its identical mates each for only	 $ 289.00.

title: For Sale:  Coach Gun .410 Double Hammers 3 inch 20 inch Century Norinco NIB 1887 Remington Copy 410 2.5 or 3 inch SG2028N
postcontent:
Our # LGSG1028N

The 1887 Remington Coach Gun was the most feared shotgun in its century. To this day, no weapon has a more calming, better petrifying, effect than a short barreled double. Chamber that device in .410 gauge, though, and it gets considerably tamer. Here is one of our all time favorites, successor to the Stoeger Arms coach guns of the 1970s, and possibly fatal competitor to the pricey Italian made Cimarrons. This is not an Italian Shotgun; it is manufactured in the world’s most populous nation by Jin Xing Machine Works. This Centurion Coach Gun model 2028 double barrel shotgun is imported by Century International Arms in Vermont. We’ve always called it a Norinco, and that is what was stamped on the first specimens we got 25 years ago. This is a Remington-type traditional Rabbit Ear or double hammer side-by-side, 3 inch chamber, 20 inch .412 Modified and .416 Imp. Cyl. tubes. It is, of course, brand new in its original rice-paper box, complete with instruction manual. These are well fitted shotguns with strong actions. Buttstock and forend appear to be light, blondish American Walnut. Factory specs are 35.75 inches OAL, 20 inch barrels, and 6.5 pounds empty. Loaded with 3 pellet buckshot, it is quite formidable. Own this fine shotgun, the one in the photo or one of its identical mates, for only $ 369.00

title: For Sale:  Super Super Rare Ithaca 1911 .45 Military Issue. @Mauldin Arms
postcontent:
Ithaca only made these for 3 years for the government. Ithaca M1911-A1 .45 acp WWII issue pistol in all correct configuration. Stamped "United States Property" and "US Army". Condition is good to very good, with some wear spots. SN: 880xxx made in 1943 according to coolgunsite.com. According to their data, this gun was in the first run of guns from Ithaca to the US Government. That order was for 60,000 units. Barrel is correct with HS on the lug.(Hi Standard) Rare chance to own one of these hard to find pistols. We have researched this gun extensively and it is the real deal. $2499

title: For Sale:  Marlin 336SS 30-30 ("RARE") stainless with 3X9 Scope, Leupold Base and rings + 80 rounds Factory Brass
postcontent: $850 CASH-Made in Connecticut has “JM” proof mark.  This is a beautiful 30-30 in great condition. Manufactured in 1999, it has a 20" barrel with a shiny bore and strong rifling. It does have a few smudges from use but no major dings.  The stock is 95%. I have been told and have read that the Marlin rifles made in Connecticut like this one are better quality then the Marlin rifles now being made in New York. (Known as “Remlins”)  The “JM” proof mark is on the barrel.  I have never owned/shot another 30-30, so, I can’t attest to that.  Please do your homework BEFORE you school me about the “new” blued Marlin 336 you can buy below $500. Visit a few Marlin Forums and learn like I did. I hesitate to call this one rare, but, you will find only a few for sale anywhere in the US. (There are plenty of new ones to choose from; go get one if the quality doesn’t matter to you) The scope is a cheap Tasco Silver Antler 3X9 40WAST that I mounted cause it looks good with it and the scope does OK for my old eyes. It is mounted with Leupold base and rings I paid $45 for.  Finally, I will throw in 40 rounds of Remington Core-LOKT 170GR and 40 rounds of Federal 150GR soft points. I have moved on to a higher capacity .308 for Hog Hunting, which is the application I bought it for. Since I am selling my only 30-30, this is a package deal and everything must go. I will be happy to sell you the rifle only, but, the price will not change. I will meet you anywhere within 30 miles of Ohio Stadium only. I paid $800 for the rifle and put a handful of rounds. I bought it used from a friend out west.  The ammo, mounts and scope were almost $200.  I will part with it for $850 or best offer over $800. My son’s son will own it before I sell it for less than $800.  I need the cash for another project, so, NO TRADES of any kind. Look for it elsewhere, then come see if I still have it. Thanks for looking!

title: For Sale:  Concealed Weapons Permit Classes $75 Pensacola
postcontent:
The class is the NRA Basic Pistol / FL Concealed Weapons Permit class.  It covers safety, hands on classroom training, live fire training at the range, personal gun selection, cleaning/caring for a firearm and the laws/rules/procedures for the FL Concealed Weapons Permit. I also have a section of the class dedicated to personal defense with a firearm.  It is not necessary to own a firearm to attend the class as I have demo models.  If you own a firearm I recommend you bring it to class so you can train with it.  We typically spend 3 to 3 1/2 hours in the classroom and about an hour on the range. Once you complete the class you will receive a certificate that satisfies the requirements for the FL CWP.  You then fill out an application, have your fingerprints and picture taken and submit the application.  The cost of the actual permit is $70 and the fingerprint / back round check is $42.  The permit is good for 7 years.  I hold the public classes in the conference rooms at Homewood Suites by Pensacola Airport (or your location for a private class of 4 or more students).  The class is $75 per student and may be paid in cash, money order or local check.  

Here is a list of my current class schedule and registration link for them. You can register now and pay on the day of class.

May 3rd Class 9am – 2pm- Registration link
http://www.nrainstructors.org/SignupStudent.aspx?id=244447

May 18th Class 9am -2pm – Registration link
http://www.nrainstructors.org/SignupStudent.aspx?id=244448

May 31st Class 9am – 2pm – Registration link
http://www.nrainstructors.org/SignupStudent.aspx?id=244449


Please call, text or email me with any questions. REDACTED  
 Thanks
Wayne Briske
NRA Instructor #202302461

The class is the NRA Basic Pistol / FL Concealed Weapons Permit class.  It covers safety, hands on classroom training, live fire training at the range, personal gun selection, cleaning/caring for a firearm and the laws/rules/procedures for the FL Concealed Weapons Permit. I also have a section of the class dedicated to personal defense with a firearm.  It is not necessary to own a firearm to attend the class as I have demo models.  If you own a firearm I recommend you bring it to class so you can train with it.  We typically spend 3 to 3 1/2 hours in the classroom and about an hour on the range. Once you complete the class you will receive a certificate that satisfies the requirements for the FL CWP.  You then fill out an application, have your fingerprints and picture taken and submit the application.  The cost of the actual permit is $70 and the fingerprint / back round check is $42.  The permit is good for 7 years.  I hold the public classes in the conference rooms at Homewood Suites by Pensacola Airport (or your location for a private class of 4 or more students).  The class is $75 per student and may be paid in cash, money order or local check.

title: For Sale:  Les Baer 1911, Monolith, Hard Chrome, custom order:  $2,000
postcontent:
Unlike other custom manufacturers, Baer manufactures his own frames and slides and is the only one who still hand fits and files the frame, slide and also "hard fits" the barrel. 

"Hard Fitting" means the upper lug and lower lugs of the barrel are hand fitted so tightly to the slide and slide stop that when in battery, the gun locks up with zero--and I do mean, ZERO--movement between the frame, slide and barrel. It's like a single block of steel. This is one of the hallmarks of a Les Baer 1911.

Baer is also the only manufacturer to offer an accuracy guarantee. His standard guns are guaranteed to shoot 3" groups at 50 yards using standard (not target) ammo.

This model, the Monolith, is less common than other Baer models. This particular Monolith is even more special since it is a Carbon Steel gun (Carbon Steel is much harder than stainless, so it can be fitted tighter, stay tighter longer and is more durable than stainless) which has been finished with Industrial Hard Chrome.

Industrial Hard Chrome is not like decorative chrome (mufflers, bumpers, etc.) because it is much, much harder. Industrial Hard Chrome is to used to coat tools such as bits and cutters that need to withstand much more use and abuse than normal tools. The finish is impervious to all chemicals and so durable that even after tens of thousands of rounds the finish still looks like new. The added cost of this finish vs. standard bluing is $350.

Further, this particular Monolith has the Front Cocking Serrations omitted and a single side safety only. This Monolith was a custom order. If someone were to order a Monolith like this one it would currently take Baer 14 months+ to deliver the gun.

I have exactly 300 rounds through the gun. Since Baer recommends a 500 round break in, this guns isn't even broken in yet. The gun is less than a year old. Comes with the original Baer cardboard box, Bear Certificate of Authenticity, two magazines, bushing wrench (you'll need it) and a nylon gun case.

I also have a gorgeous set of Stag grips that I can add for an extra $75.

The original cost of this gun was $2,500. 

I would also consider trades for equal value or trades for lesser value, plus cash.

Items I'm interested in: DSA FAL, Arsenal SAM7 (milled receiver), Bulgarian/Chinese Milled AKs, Springfield SOCOM. If you have something else, just ask, worst I can do is say no.

Pics of the actual gun: http://imgur.com/a/YC3qK#0

title: For Sale:  AK47 Saiga variant 7.62x39 Russian made NIB 10 shot magazine rail Izmash
postcontent:
Our # LGIZ132

From the former Soviet Union comes this excellent descendant of Commander Kalashnikov’s invention. This is the Russian Saiga, named after one of their principal game antelope, because we surely don’t want to shoot any of Saint Nicholas’s reindeer. Manufacturer is Izmash Arms Factory of Izhevsk, Russia. Construction is entirely steel parts with black polymer buttstock and forend. Importer on the photo specimen and its mates is RWC Group, Tullytown, PA, one of a dozen or so in a succession of importers. Type, of course, is Kalashnikov action gas operated semi-automatic centerfire rifle. Model is simply Saiga, but this variant, chambered in 7.62x39 Each Saiga Rifle comes with a 10 round detachable magazine, using AK magazines will require some modification to the trunnion area. Barrel length is 16.3 inches; and overall length is a compact 37.3 inches. Weight empty is a solid 7.93 pounds, so these are exceptionally light recoiling rifles. Sights are conventional windage and elevation adjustable, and stock and forend are durable black synthetic, equipped with integral sling swivel studs. Bore, chamber, and gas tube interior are all chrome lined for maximum durability. These fine rifles were designed for steel case ammunition; they’re every bit as tough as the Ruger Mini 30. Replacement pricing for the Mini 30 is upwards of $800 apiece in our area. We’re offering the lighter, rugged Saiga in the photos, however, or one of its identical mates, each for only $ 539.00. Not transferable to civilian residents of California, Chicago, Connecticut, D.C., Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Puerto Rico, or any other jurisdiction where Kalashnikov Action Firearms are restricted to law enforcement only. ProMag is in production on 30 shot magazines for these rifles. 

$20 flat fee lower 48 states; $60 Alaska, Hawaii or Puerto Rico, UPS Ground or USPS Priority with full insurance coverage. Don’t let your buddies use your account, that kind of thing smells like felony level straw purchase attempt. NO AMEX NO PAYPAL. GA Pay / MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped ASAP. 7 day hold on checks. FFL ok by fax, e-mail or mail, please ask your dealer to put your name and Gun Brand on there. 7 day money back on used, no return on New Items, layaway, or ammo. We do not pay transfer fees or return shipping. Lay-away 20% down, balance in 90 days. Phone hours 8:30 – 4:30 CST Mon - Fri CST. Local pickup OK. title: For Sale:  Armscor .22 LR M1600 AR15 Copy or Trainer NIB 10 Shot Magazine Armscor Precision API 22 Long Rifle Caliber
postcontent:
Our # LG51111

Here is the original M-16 trainer introduced during the Reagan Era, and wildly popular during the Bush Sr / Clinton Ban Years. This M-1600 is manufactured by Armscor of the Philippines, the company that brings us their excellent 1911 pistols that perform so very well. Action type is, of course, blowback semi-auto, and it is a direct descendant of the Remington 550-1 rifles that are still in service after 60 years. Sights are correct aperture rear and post front with authentic carry handle and gas housing replicas. Magazines are 10 round blue steel, housed in a correct-looking and fitting AR-15 type housing. Extra 10, 15, and even 25 shot magazines are in production, and we stock them when we can get them. Forend and buttstock are classic Colt SP-1 Vietnam Era styling black ebony stained hardwood with removable vertical pistol grip. The forend configuration allows barrel exposure for better heat dissipation. Shoppers note that the pistol grip installs easily with furnished bolt, same way with the sling. Barrel is 18 1/4 inch blue steel with 1:16 rifling, and receiver is blued steel as well. Weight empty is a well balanced 6 1/2 pounds. We have sold substantial numbers of this brand rifle with good results since the 1970s, when the 550-1 phased out and the Filipino manufacturers filled the gap with a good quality economically priced rifle marketed under the Squibman and K-Mart brands, then Armscor. ARMSCOR uses, writes the factory, only high grade ordnance steel for all major parts for durability and mechanical reliability even in the most adverse operating conditions. Instruction manual and magazine indicates high velocity .22 ammo; our local customers have always had best results with Winchester, Federal, and Aguila coppercoated ammunition. This is a good little rifle, but it is NOT a garbage-mouthed Ruger 10/22. Own the rifle in the photo or one of its identical mates for only $ 199.00. Not transferable to civilians in Chicago or New York City.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 12 gauge Model 590 Special Purpose Tactical 9 Shot AT Combat Stock Bayonet Lug Heat Shield 3 inch 20 inch Cylinder 50667 to 50645 Configuration
postcontent:
Our # LG50667ATS

Here is the immediate ancestor to the current production Mossberg 590 A1, the blue and anodized receiver 590. Manufacturer, of course, is O.F. Mossberg & Sons of New Haven, CT. Original sku was Mossberg number 50667, and that is what its box label reads. We have subbed, however, an ATS, Advanced Technologies full length combat type buttstock with pistol grip so that this Mossberg is closer to the 50645 factory variant. Construction is steel barrel, bolt, and internal parts with lightweight alloy receiver and polymer trigger group housing. Capacity is 8 + 1 on 2 3/4 inch shells, or 7 + 1 on 3 inch magnums. Barrel is 20 inch Police Cylinder with perforated Trench Gun type heat shield. Front sight is Hex based solid brass, threaded into place. Forend is traditional serrated Corncob configuration polymer. Buttstock is manufactured by ATI, DuPont® Extreme Temperature Glass Reinforced Polymer with stippled pebble surface pistol grip, and measures for a 14 inch length of pull including the 1 inch super absorbent scorpion recoil pad. Overall length is 41 inches. Metal is matte blue steel on the barrel, magazine tube, and double steel slide arms, with black matte anodized finish to the lightweight alloy receiver. Safety, as the photos show, is traditional Mossberg top tang, polymer construction and user-friendly for southpaws. This shotgun is also equipped with a bayonet lug that will accept an M8A1, M16 / M4 Bayonet or similarly equipped accessories. Weight empty is 7.2 pounds. Magazine capacity is 8 + 1 on 2 3/4 inch shells, and 7+1 on 3 inch shells. It and its mates are brand new shotguns, shipped as cruiser grip Persuader type. We changed their stocks to ATS, and had to rebox them. The original box label is taped to the instruction manual envelope. Current pricing on the 590 is upwards of $700 apiece in our area, and they’re scarce. We’re offering this 590 in the photos, however, or one of its identical mates for only $ 439.00. Not transferable to civilian residents of New York, or any jurisdiction where pump shotguns with 8 round magazine capacity are restricted to Law Enforcement Only. Add $19.00 for a factory Pistol Grip kit, but note that pistol grip kit inclusion requires a consumer age of 21, and residence in the jurisdiction where the consumer receives the shotgun.

$20 flat fee lower 48 states; $60 Alaska, Hawaii or Puerto Rico, UPS Ground or USPS Priority with full insurance coverage. Don’t let your buddies use your account, that kind of thing smells like felony level straw purchase attempt. NO AMEX NO PAYPAL. We accept MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped ASAP. 7 day hold on checks. FFL ok by fax, e-mail or mail, please ask your dealer to put your name and Gun Brand on there. 7 day money back on used, no return on New Items, layaway, or ammo. We do not pay transfer fees or return shipping. Lay-away 20% down, balance in 90 days. Phone hours 8:00 – 5:00 CST Mon - Fri CST. Local pickup OK. title: For Sale:  Marlin .30-30 model 336Y Compact 16 inch Trapper & Youth Length 6 Shot Lever Action 3030 Winchester caliber Matte Blue 12 3/4 inch Laminated Stock New Haven CT mfg
postcontent:
Our # LG70524

For many years, when young people grew up wanting to hunt, the Marlin 336 overshadowed its arch competitor 1894 Winchester as the most popular firearm in our inventory. Due to electronic devices and a leisure culture that have taken the place of a work and hunting ethic, this rifle’s marketability has suffered. We can only hope that our growing female hunting and cowgirl operatives take up some of the slack. Photo shows the first specimen we received of the Marlin 336Y Compact Lever Action Rifle. Manufacturer is nominally Marlin Firearms of North Haven, CT, and the barrel is so marked. Actual production, however, is at the Remington plant in Ilion, New York. Type is lever action repeating rifle. Construction is entirely steel, weather resistant matte blue finish. Buttstock and forend are laminate construction hardwood, also weather resistant and incredibly strong. Pistol grip area and forend have machine cut checkering that is both attractive and ergonomic. Barrel is 16 1/4 inch, 1:10 Micro-Groove twelve groove rifling, hooded screw-on steel front sight with classic step-elevator adjustable buckhorn folding rear sight. Forend to barrel band is equipped with a QD swivel stud, and so is the buttstock. Receiver is flat topped blue steel, 4 position drilled to accept Weaver 63B type bases, 336 and 1894 type see-through scope rings, or best, Leupold steel 49987 one piece Redfield JR type base. Marlin anodized alloy hammer spur is included for mounting the scope low to the receiver. Caliber, of course, is .30-30 Winchester, and the short trapper length magazine holds 5 rounds, 5+1 total capacity. Trigger is .275 smooth faced blue steel, and the photo specimen gauged at a stiff but safe 8 pounds with minimal creep. A competent gunsmith can smooth it and get it down to half that, perhaps even less. We, however, are neither competent nor gunsmiths. Length of pull from the trigger face to the end of the buttstock is 12 3/4 inches, and overall length is 34 inches. Weight empty is 6 pounds 11 ounces, with the center of gravity at the lever bolt. Hammer is 3 position serrated spur type, with half cock position. All Marlin levers had lever safeties since their invention, the little protruding tab directly behind the receiver; all Marlin levers manufactured since 1983, like this one, have a cross bolt safety as well. This is a classic little rifle. We’re offering the 336Y Compact Marlin in the photos or one of its identical mates for only $ 369.00. 2% discount, always, if payment is with USPS Money Order & not credit card.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 12 gauge Cruiser JIC Desert Sandstorm 3 inch 18 1/2 in Cylinder Bore 6 Shot Trench Gun type Heat Shield Excellent Factory Demo 53340TU
postcontent:
Our # LG53340TU

Photo specimen is representative from this lot of shotguns, all of them are within 5 percentage points on their finish grade, excellent condition. We can furnish photos of any exact specimen upon request. Dealers, law enforcement, and collectors may take any number of virtually identical shotguns we have on hand at the same per-gun price and with no extra shipping charges Here is a very powerful weapon, one that the operator should keep well away from his face. Not a comfortable shooting weapon, unless someone is doing varmint control with Super Light 2 3/4 inch shells, but a powerful one. For a good balance between firepower and felt recoil, a 3 inch Magnum load with 1 1/4 oz. BB Steel Shot delivers 90 Pellets at 1400 feet per second from the muzzle and that figures the rough equivalent of 2 boxes of .17 Mach II bullets all in one shot. Consumers must be at least 21 years of age to own one of these, any shotgun with a pistol grip has Federal Status as a hand gun for age requirement purposes. This is Mossberg's JIC series Desert Sandstorm Cruiser, the Persuader 12 gauge pistol grip variant of the tried-and-true Model 500 slide action with tang safety, easily employed by Left Handed Shooters. This listing is for the exact shotgun in the photos, but collectors, departments, and dealers are welcome to take any number of the same model, very similar condition, that we have on hand. JIC, as one suspects, stands for Just In Case. The Persuaders are virtual duplicates of the proven Mossberg military 500 and 590 models. Factory specs are: double slide bar pump shotgun; 12 gauge 2 3/4 and 3 inch shells; 18 1/2 inch Cylinder Bore Barrel; Desert Sandstorm special purpose dip type factory camo finish, with matching high impact desert polymer forend and pistol grip; weight 5 3/4 pounds empty; capacity 5 + 1 with 2 3/4 inch shells, or 4 + 1 with 3 inch magnums; overall length 28 3/4 inches. This specimen is what we call a factory demo, a showpiece for Mossberg’s sales team that has been in Mossberg Corporate custody until we got it. Surface detractions are negligible to minimal on this shotgun, as its photos show. We rate it as Excellent, perhaps Near Mint, but photos ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. Often a person can spot the letter U stamped on the left side of the receiver above the serial number. Bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright and clean. This 500 JIC Cruiser comes in a relabeled Mossberg Factory Box with factory lock, instruction manual, NSSF and NRA flyers. It does not come with any extras besides the added heat shield. We have even outfitted it with a matching trench type heat shield. If this shotgun was test fired, it was fewer than 20 times. In its tubed form, replacement pricing is $540 on mossberg com. We’re offering the Mossberg shotgun in the photos, however, or one of its virtually identical mates,    for only$ 289.00. Buyers must be at least 21 Years of Age; the Cruiser grip gives this shotgun Other Weapon status on the 4473 form. Local pickup by a civilian non dealer has to be a Tennessee Resident. title: For Sale:  Like NEW Springfield Armory XDS .45 ACP plus extras (Post-recall)
postcontent:
I have a Like NEW Springfield Armory XDS .45 ACP Caliber handgun for sale. I sent it to Springfield to get the recall work done on it months and months ago and just received it back recently.  I decided while waiting to get this gun back that I would prefer a 9mm subcompact so I purchased a Glock 26.  I don't need both of these subcompact handguns as I have a Sig Sauer P250 also in the Subcompact size.  However, I do not NEED to sell it quickly so my price is about as low as I can go on this firearm.  I do have other handguns that I am also either selling currently or would be willing to sell if the right person is interested.  The details of this handgun and the extras that come with it are listed below:

1) One Springfield Armory XDS handgun in .45 ACP caliber.  Color is all black.
2) Recall work has been performed and I tested it once it was returned to me and it is just as smooth as it was the day I bought it.  Since Springfield had it tied up in the recall backlog for the majority of the time I have owned it, it has less than 50 rds through it!  
3) Original box/case
4) Springfield dual mag holder
5) Springfield handgun lock
6) FOUR (4) standard 5 round mags and ONE (1) extended 7 round mag
7) One Pearce Grip Extension (installed as new floor plate on one of the 5 rd mags).
8) Like New IWB Versacarry holster.  See Versacarry.com for more info on this fantastic holster).  This holster was never used but removed from original packaging.  (I paid $30.86)
9) NEW "Leather by Don" custom made Shoot Through Premium Leather Pocket Holster (I paid $42.95).   I ordered this holster from Don directly and he made it custom specifically for this XDS .45 ACP (so this is NOT a holster that fits other gun models as well).

ASKING PRICE FOR HANDGUN AND ITEMS #1-7 = $475.00
ASKING PRICE FOR HANDGUN AND ITEMS #1-8 = $495.00
ASKING PRICE FOR HANDGUN AND ITEMS #1-9 = $525.00

Again, this handgun is LNIB with less than 50 rounds total through it.  It has been cleaned meticulously and if I told you it was brand new, I doubt you could tell the difference.  In addition, I have also kept the original sales receipts for all the items listed as well as the paperwork returned when I received the gun back from the recall.

I am asking a VERY FAIR price as I paid exactly $635.63 for ALL of the above.  The handgun, case, lock, paperwork, etc (Items # 1-7) costs me $561.82 exactly.  If you add the $561.82 I paid for the handgun etc., the $30.86 for the Versacarry holster, and the $42.95 for the Shoot Through Pocket Holster...I have exactly $635.63 in this awesome handgun "package".

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 12 gauge model 500 All Purpose Black Matte & Synthetic 3 inch 28 inch .715 Accu-Choke Ported Vent Rib Recoil Pad Excellent Condition Factory Demo 56420ZU
postcontent:
Our # LG56420ZU

Photo specimen is representative from this lot of shotguns, all of them are within 5 percentage points on their finish grade, excellent condition. We can furnish photos of any exact specimen upon request. Dealers, law enforcement, and collectors may take any number of virtually identical shotguns we have on hand at the same per-gun price and with no extra shipping charges. The Mossberg model 500 has never been as prestigious as the arch-competitor Remington 870, but it’s just as tried, and just as true. Here is a pristine specimen of Mossberg’s model 500 All Purpose 12 gauge with water resistant qualities. This listing is for the exact shotgun in the photos, but dealers are welcome to take any number of the same model, very similar condition, that we have on hand. Manufacturer, of course, is O.F. Mossberg & Sons of New Haven, CT. Model is 500 All Purpose. Factory sku is 56420 vicinity. Type is pump or slide action shotgun. Construction is steel barrel and working parts all built into an alloy receiver that undercuts the 870 on weight, with weather resistant, recoil absorbing black synthetic stock and forend. Finish is weather resistant matte black steel barrel, black anodized receiver, and chrome plated bolt and shell carrier. Trigger group housing is high impact black polymer, with .292 smooth faced trigger. Safety is top tang type. Barrel is 3 inch chambered parkerized steel, 28 inch Ventilated Rib, with 16 ports for reduced felt recoil. Choke tube is marked as modified, but it measures .715 vicinity, something we call Improved Cylinder, steel, slug, and buckshot permissible. Accu-choke threads on the 500s are the same as old style Winchester Win-Choke and old style Browning Invector. This barrel will accept any Accu-choke or either of those two. It will NOT accept an Accu-Mag, or a Browning Invector Plus, or a Rem-Choke, or the exhaust pipe of a 1940 Briggs & Stratton WMB Muffler. Sight system is 12 post serrated top Ventilated Rib with brass center bead and ivory colored front bead sight. Magazine capacity is 5 rounds of 2 3/4 inch shells, or 4 rounds of 3 inch shells, and the distinctive Mossberg adapter plug is included to bring a hunter in compliance with 2+1 shot regulations. Weight empty is 7 1/2 pounds, with center of gravity about 1 inch forward of the receiver. Buttstock measures 13 7/8 inches from the trigger face to the end of the 7/8 inch black rubber factory recoil pad. Stock drop is 1 1/2 inches at the comb, and 2 1/2 inches at the butt, with a right hand cant of about 3/4 inch. This model 500 comes to us from Mossberg’s distribution system. It is what we call a factory demo, probably a sales rep’s sample or a showgirl at a Firearms Industry trade show. Surface detractions are negligible to minimal on this shotgun, as its photos show. We rate it as Excellent, perhaps Near Mint, but photos ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. Often a person can spot the letter U stamped on the left side of the receiver above the serial number. Bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright and clean.This model 500 comes in a relabeled Mossberg Factory Box with factory lock, instruction manual, NSSF and NRA flyers. If this shotgun was test fired, it was fewer than 20 times. Replacement pricing on mossberg com is upwards of $400 on this shotgun. We’re offering the Mossberg 500 in the photos, however, or one of its virtually identical mates,    for only $ 219.00. This shotgun comes with only one Accu-Choke tube, and no wrench. A quarter works well enough. Accu-chokes are two slot tubes, 4 slot Remington wrenches won’t work. 

$20 flat fee lower 48 states; $60 Alaska, Hawaii or Puerto Rico, UPS Ground or USPS Priority with full insurance coverage. Don’t let your buddies use your account, that kind of thing smells like felony level straw purchase attempt. NO AMEX NO PAYPAL. We accept MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped ASAP. 7 day hold on checks. FFL ok by fax, e-mail or mail, please ask your dealer to put your name and Gun Brand on there. 7 day money back on used, no return on New Items, layaway, or ammo. We do not pay transfer fees or return shipping. Lay-away 20% down, balance in 90 days. Phone hours 8:00 – 5:00 CST Mon - Fri CST. Local pickup OK. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340 We Buy, Sell, or Trade.

title: For Sale:  Glenfield/Marlin Model 60
location: Marcy, New York, Adirondacks, New York
postcontent: This is a beautiful Glenfield/Marlin model 60. It was made in 1981 before they shortened the barrels. It has the 22 inch barrel and holds 18 rounds of .22 Long Rifle ammo. The magazine tube has the Brass Rod. Others had the steel rod that was prone to rusting. I put  a brand new Simmons 3/9/32 scope on it and it shoots great. Cycles all types of .22 ammo from high velocity to standard velocity as well as all brands. I stripped the stock and put hours of labor into a hand rubbed boiled Linseed Oil finish. It has the squirrel engravings on both sides of the butt stock and the maple leaf engravings on both sides of the forearm. I  installed sling studs on the butt stock and forearm for a sling or bi-pod. I'm retired and did this gun over for a fun project. The gun looks and shoots beautiful the only blemish is a few spots on the left side of the barrel that had started to rust, see photos.They were steel wooled with 2000 steel wool and oiled. The bluing is all original. The muzzle crown is excellent as is the bore. This gun has the Marlin Micro groove rifling which is 16 lands instead of the standard 8 deep cut lands. The 16 lands are not cut as deep and the theory is accuracy is improved since the bullet is not as deformed by the deep cut lands and as a result is more stable and accurate. The gun had sat for years in a closet and had been fired very little when I acquired it. It's received many compliments and now it's time for me to find another project gun. I can only download 3 pictures to this site. I have over 20 pictures of the gun. Should you want to see more send me your email address and I'll forward them to you.

title: For Sale:  COP 357 Derringer
postcontent:
The COP 357 is a 4 shot Derringer type pistol chambered for the powerful .357 Magnum round. It was designed by Robert Hillberg, based on his earlier work on the Hillberg Insurgency Weapon. It was manufactured by the now defunct COP Inc. of 3040 West Lomita Blvd., Torrance, California (COP stood for Compact Off-Duty Police). The double action weapon is only slightly larger than the typical .25 automatic pistol, which made it a good choice for a defensive weapon or a police backup gun.

Construction and operation of the COP 357

The COP 357 is quite robust in design and construction. It is made of solid stainless steel components. Cartridges are loaded into the four separate chambers by sliding a latch that "pops-up" the barrel for loading purposes, similar to top-break shotguns. Each of the four chambers has its own dedicated firing pin. It uses an internal hammer, which is activated by depressing the trigger to hit a ratcheting/rotating striker that in turn strikes one firing pin at a time. Older "pepperboxes" also used multiple barrels, but the barrels were the part that rotated. The COP 357 is unique in that it uses the ratcheting/rotating striker, which is completely internal, to fire each chamber in sequence.

The weapon has appeared in numerous films, including Blade Runner, The Matrix Reloaded, and Bad Boys.

 Local Pick Up my location--- REDACTED (May Trade?)

title: For Sale:  Egyptian Maadi AK-47 / AKM
location: Minneapolis/St. Paul, Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota
postcontent:
$515.00 O.B.O. 

Comes with 140 Rounds of ammo!

I have for sale an Egyptian Maadi-Misr AK-47 for sale.  This rifle was bought from a police auction and missing parts were added by myself with original Egyptian Maadi parts.  The only thing missing from this firearm is a firing pin retainer.  I have a brand new firing pin, but have not yet ordered the $3.00 retainer pin.  

The firearm looks to be in overall good condition (minus the chip in the stock).  It was my intent to sand the furnishings down and re-finish them this summer, but the boss (my fiancé) says it needs to go.  Apparently "Do what you want" means do NOT do what you want haha!

Anyway on a serious note, this is a firearm built by Maadi in Egypt.  The receiver was built on Russian machinery and is the closest to a Russian AK as you can get so I hear.  It was imported by C.A.I.  This is a post ban AK and has a thumbhole stock which is easily replaced.  I have found numerous sites that sell a variety of stocks for this model.  I would be happy to assist any potential buyer in finding parts if they would like.  I have been informed that these Egyptian Maadi rifles are VERY dependable firearms and are well sought after.  This particular model being the "Misr" is on the lower end of the collectibles due to the fact that some people say the finish wasn't up to "collector standards", but that doesn't mean this firearm won't live up to the dependability both Maadi (and AK's in general) are known for!

I also have an extra pistol grip and gas tube that I will throw in with the lot.

o
The Walther PPS (Police Pistol Slim) is a semi-automatic pistol made in Germany by Walther Sportwaffen. It was first shown in 2007 and is a slim polymer framed weapon of similar size to the Walther PPK. The 9mm version is to feature magazines of 6, 7, and 8 round lengths so the shooter can customize the grip to their hand size and concealment needs. 

It will feature a partially cocked striker system like the Walther P99 Quick Action model. This particular variant is called QuickSafe and the primary change from QA is that removing the pistol's backstrap will disable the gun for safe storage.
